dialogues.text: crosses the street in front of them. He's just a yuppie phone. But Terry stiffens in her seat, watching him suspiciously. Then, almost as an aside, he winks at her. TERRY (cont'd) Drive.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: I can't. There's a red.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Then make a right. Just keep driving. Julia is growing frightened by Terry's paranoia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rover makes a right turn and cruises down another block.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Terry keeps her eyes riveted on the PEOPLE on the sidewalk. She's practic tears.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Remember when we hit that thing with the car? (hushed) It wasn't an accident. It was a set-up. They planned it all along.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: How do you know  this?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Sam told me. He figured everything out.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Why are they coming after us? What do they want with us?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: They have flesh and metal parts in their bodies. Sometimes they shed what need. But other parts keep getting worn out or lost. So they take p constantly to get new parts.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: (soft) That's not  possible.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: They wear the skin. That's why you don't notice them. Half of the time wearing people's skin. Or they're hiding in dark places. Alleys. Julia is horrified.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Terry ... please stop.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: They take other parts too. Whatever they need. They're scavengers. No sen compassion. No remorse.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: I don't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: That's why they came after us. They got Joey first. At the cabin. Julia is dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Joey?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: That's what Sam saw. That's why he left. He woke up and got a look at the they were doing to Joey ...

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Terry ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stripping him ... taking his skin off ... Julia pulls over to the curb and stops.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Who is Joey? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (amazed) You don't remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were five of us. He came up in his own car. He was always wore the same thing for Christ sakes.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: There were only four of us. You. Me. Paul. Sam. Terry is shaking now. Complete fright.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: They got to you. They got to you.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Nobody got to me. Paul's best friend -- they  Terry starts collecting her things.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Look, could you drop me off at my brother's apartment? I need to pick up before I go to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: To see my parents.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: You can't just leave.  Terry starts weeping. Grabbing her legs and squeezing them.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: They put things in my legs so they can track me. It hurts.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: (very concerned) Terry? What can I do to help you? Terry takes her hand. Her eyes pleading.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Remember me. Please remember me. From the street outside the car, the sound of a TODDLER CRYING can be he head snaps around. She stares out the windshield at the screaming ch TERRY (cont'd) They found me again. Before Julia can react, Terry bolts from the car.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Terry! Julia pursues.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCISCO
dialogues.text: Julia pushes and shoves her way along the sidewalk. Terry is running l madwoman. Pure unabated terror.  Terry rushes down into a subway entrance. Julia follows.

dialogues.speaker: STATION
dialogues.text: People are crowded on the platform, waiting as a BART train rushes i station. The doors open. Passengers move off the train. Others get on. Julia rushes down the stairs and pushes past the arriving commuters. T sign of Terry. Julia keeps searching. Looks right. Then left. Fin spots Terry boarding the BART train.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Terry! Wait!  Julia rushes forward, squirming through the crowd, until she reaches t as they SLAM CLOSED. She looks through the windows, trying to fin amongst the crowd inside. The train starts to move. Standing at one of the train's passenger windows, his face and palms pres the glass, is --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SUPERMAN SHIRT.
dialogues.text: Staring directly at her. Dark circles around his eyes. He smiles at Julia. HIS TEETH ARE MADE OF METAL.  Julia stands thunderstruck. The BOY in the window moves past. The train shoots into the awaiting tunnel. Julia is left standing f immobile on the platform. Near the subway entrance, a HOMELESS MAN with HOOKS FOR HANDS is convulsi against the wall. Eyes wide open. Shaking horribly and staring at

dialogues.speaker: BUILDING
dialogues.text: Quiet and dimly lit. Several of the lights are burnt out, leaving the hal in shadows. The elevator doors open. Terry exits and moves quickly down the hallwa is terrified. Sick. She arrives at  an apartment. Terry fumbles with her keys. A soft THUMPING in the hallway. Deep and hollow. Terry spins around, the keys JINGLING in her hand Nothing there. The hall appears to be empty and dark. One of the lights flickering and BUZZING softly, providing scant illumination. She takes a step back ... A soft TINKLING sound at her feet. Terry looks down to find a few pieces littering the floor. Nuts and bolts. Rods. Alien in design. Terry's paranoia rises to a fever pitch. She turns the key in the the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry shuts the door. Locks it. Switches on the lights. Drops her KEYS and CELL PHONE on a coffee table. She moves briskly into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An open suitcase on the bed. Terry snatches up a PLANE TICKET and ticket folder into her purse. Slams the suitcase closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry leaves the bedroom, carrying the suitcase, and walks straight to front door. She collects her keys and her cell phone from the table.

dialogues.speaker: OUT.
dialogues.text: Terry is caught entirely off guard. She spins around to face the living there. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: THEN STOPS DEAD.
dialogues.text: Terry's breathing quickens. She puts the suitcase down. A crack of THUNDER reverberates outside. Moving with the cautious steps of a small child, she walks towards the fr Foot by foot. The only sound is her FRIGHTENED BREATHING. She arrives a peephole and looks out into the empty hall.

dialogues.speaker: STARES BACK AT HER THROUGH THE PEEPHOLE.
dialogues.text: Moving right in front of the door. One of its yellow eyes piercing throu surrounded by midnight skin pierced with metal bolts and rods.

dialogues.speaker: HER LUNGS OUT.
dialogues.text: The DOOR RATTLES like it's going to break off its hinges. Somethin

dialogues.speaker: REPEATEDLY
dialogues.text: against the wood. Terry tears through the apartment, feet POUNDING. She rushes into the The front door in the living room BREAKS OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry SLAMS the bedroom door and locks it. Backs away towards the bed, wh

dialogues.speaker: OUT FROM UNDER IT ...
dialogues.text: Grabbing hold of her ankle. Fused together from rotting flesh, human pa metal pieces. Terry pitches forward, SCREAMING, falling to her hands an The hand starts dragging her under the bed. Terry kicks and claws on the floor. Somehow manages to free herself from grip. She goes for the window and pulls it open. Steps outside. The entire bed is OVERTURNED and tossed aside.

dialogues.speaker: BUILDING
dialogues.text: Terry is immediately drenched by the storm. The door within her be heard CRASHING OPEN, followed by a ROARING unlike anything on t Terry rushes  down the fire escape, FEET BANGING dead in her tracks when she notices --

dialogues.speaker: SEVERAL FIGURES
dialogues.text: Standing in the alley far below. Looking up at her. A sound rises on the metal Waiting. steps. But she stops up behind her. THE SOUND OF FOOTSTEPS BANGING DOWN THE FI PURSUIT.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (horrified) Oh God ... Terry desperately goes to a window. She pulls it open,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stepping inside,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment floor is being renovated. Plastic tarps cover the doors a Terry races through the hallway, SCREAMING WILDLY as she POUNDS on th

dialogues.speaker: HELP
dialogues.text: Terry rockets around the corner. She presses the elevator door button f The sound of CROAKING and HISSING fills the hallway. The elevator doors slide open. Terry lunges into the elevator, hits for the lobby, then starts BEATIN on the door close button.  Several shadows appear in the hallway. Getting closer. Terry SCREAMS WILDLY and keeps pounding the button. The bizarre HISSING becomes a FRIGHTFUL ROAR just as ... The elevator doors pull shut. Closing on the unseen things in the

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The car starts going down. Floor lights blink above the door. Terry punches out 9-1-1 on the cell phone's keypad. through the receiver. Only static.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: hallway. Nothing comes  Come on ... come on ... She dials again. More static over the cell phone. Terry has started crying in anguish elevator comes to an abrupt halt. The doors stay closed. Terry looks above the elevator doors. The floor light reads -- wBn (Basement) Terry starts pressing for the lobby. The elevator won't move. She pres open" button, the alarm button, anything at all. Nothing respo TERRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: HELP ME
dialogues.text: Nothing. Futile silence. She's about to try dialing on the cell phone aga WHUMP. A heavy thudding sound above the elevator car roof. The light ove flickers like a candle. Terry gazes at the failing light, then tracks her the trap door in the roof. A FEW MORE HOLLOW THUMPS. Terry is petrified. She takes a step backward. The light flashes o again ... creating a strobe light effect. Behind her, the elevator doors silently pull open.  Terry's gaze is still focussed on the ceiling trap door. Behind her, the pitch black. She continues moving backwards towards the open el step after step, completely unaware ...

dialogues.speaker: LEAPS OUT OF THE DARK AND GRABS HER.
dialogues.text: In the moment it takes to draw a breath and scream, it's already over. The light goes out.

dialogues.speaker: BUILDING
dialogues.text: The lobby is vacant and terribly still. The elevator doors remain clos

dialogues.speaker: THUMPING
dialogues.text: sounds coming from the shaft far below. Then  nothing.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCISCO
dialogues.text: The sound of a PHONE LINE RINGING. Julia is sitting inside of the parked Range Rover, the cell phone against her ear.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (from phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Hello ... is this Mr. Alba?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to call you so late ...

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: This is Julia Levin. We met a few days ago at graduation. I'm a friend Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Terry. Your daughter? More silence. JULIA (cont'd) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I don't have a daughter.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You must have the wrong number.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: (beat) No, this is the right number ... CLICK! The MAN hangs up the phone on the other line. JULIA (cont'd) Hello? Julia stares at the cell phone in stunned confusion, until a sharp pain c through her hand. She FLINCHES and nearly drops the phone. Julia chec pricked finger. The WOUND HAS GROWN. An infected red spot with a open hole in the cent actually seems to be rotting around it, allowing the wound to expa sinkhole.

dialogues.speaker: MARKET
dialogues.text: A small box of aspirin are taken from the shelf. Paul tightens his fist around the box, shutting his eyes, fighting the the pain in his head. He takes a deep breath and moves to the regi

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: Need anything else?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (weak)  The CASHIER rings him up.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: Four thirty-two. Paul flips open his wallet. His face drops into shock. There's nothing inside his wallet. No credit cards. No money. No driver's a thing. CASHIER (cont'd) Something wrong? Paul can barely speak.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Not  Um... I must've brought the wrong wallet. Sorry. Paul walks out of the store.

dialogues.speaker: STORE
dialogues.text: Paul stops outside, running his fingers through his hair, digging th skull.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) That's not possible ... that's not possible ... A SHAPE grabs his shoulder. Paul spins around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LADY stands behind him. Pleading eyes. Dishevelled and ca grime. She holds up the drooping sleeve where a hand once was.

dialogues.speaker: BAG LADY
dialogues.text: Help me. They took my hand. Paul stumbles back. Horrified. BAG LADY (cont'd) (weeping) They took my hand ... Paul turns and starts running. Faster than he's ever run in his life. Di down the dark street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small and trendy. Young clientele.

dialogues.speaker: SHOP
dialogues.text: Julia sits at an empty booth. Staring at various black and white photog graduation. The four friends are sitting together on the back porch, the camera. She squeezes her finger to help numb the pain, her mind turning.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: (to herself) Joey ... (then)  Terry, what were you talking about? Julia flips to another photograph. A picture of Julia, Paul, Sam, and Te UCLA campus. Dressed for graduation. Julia shakes her head. Her eyes are locked on the faces of her friends JULIA (cont'd) There's four of us. There's only four of us. Beat. She studies the picture ... Beat. Julia sits up in her chair. A revelation crosses her face. JULIA (cont'd)  whisper) Who took the picture? Julia looks like she's falling into a deep hole. Her mind is racing f FLASHBACK: INT.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: I've been fantasizing about a guy.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Anyone we know? FLASHBACK: EXT.

dialogues.speaker: CABIN
dialogues.text: The BLOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUDENT sits back on the hood of a sports car. The tattoo insignia visible on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (cont'd) There were five of us. He came up in his own car. FLASHBACK: EXT. SAM'S HOUSE - GARDEN - DAY<="" b="">style="TEXT-TRANSFORM Paul smiling his killer grin at Julia. Wearing his white shirt and gold and blue striped tie.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (v.0.) He was Paul's best friend -- FLASHBACK: INT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BLOND STUDENT loosens his gold and blue striped tie from his wh collar as he undresses. TERRY (V.O.) (cont'd) -- they always wore the same thing for Christ sakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia's HORRIFIED FACE.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: (completely lost) No  FLASHBACK: INT.

dialogues.speaker: SAM'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: The BLOND STUDENT standing half-naked in front of Julia. Holding a ripped jeans. JULIA (cont'd) I'm sorry. I was just using the (laughs) Really. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: I'll forgive you this once. FLASHBACK: INT.

dialogues.speaker: CABIN
dialogues.text: Julia turns her head and gazes at

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: Sitting ina chair. Smoking a cigarette. Smiling down at her.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (v.0.) It's just a fantasy. FLASHBACK: INT.

dialogues.speaker: CABIN
dialogues.text: Candles have been placed around the room. Paul and Terry are asleep on Blood drips over the SUPERMAN TATTOO on Joey's shoulder.  Julia slowly awakens to the sounds of JOEY SCREAMING over sickening RI like cloth being torn in half. There are SILHOUETTES ON THE WALL of THREE FIGURES tearing off pieces of something in the room. Larg Chunks. Moving rapidly and ferociously. Julia spots Sam SCREAMING across the room.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (shrieking)

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Julia turns her head in the direction of the ripping and tearing sounds. slowly widen as her mouth drops into a soundless, petrified look of ho A hand with midnight skin, six fingers, and punctured with steel rods eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SHOP
dialogues.text: A plate SMASHES on the floor. Julia is jolted out of her thought, looks over to find a WAITER picking u The lights flicker in the shop. This unnerves Julia completel gathering the photographs together. She becomes aware of the pain in her finger again. Looks at the scab.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Terry's legs Paul's headaches A thought  crashes like thunder in her head. JULIA (cont'd) Oh no Julia quickly grabs a knife from the table. She gets up and walks strai ladies restroom.

dialogues.speaker: SHOP
dialogues.text: Cramped and dirty. Julia holds her finger over the sink. With the point of the knife's blade, she begins digging into her finger. immediate. Julia grimaces, tears forming in her eyes, as the wound b bright red. BLOOD DRIPS INTO THE SINK. Julia drops the knife into the sink and pinches the wound. Squeezing har

dialogues.speaker: WOUND .
dialogues.text: Julia continues squeezing, tears rolling, fingernails digging into the wo

dialogues.speaker: METAL SPLINTER PUSHES UP THROUGH THE BLOOD.
dialogues.text: Julia starts pulling it out of her finger. The splinter rises from the and rises and rises More blood spatters into the sink. Julia is GASPING and CRYING as the pain becomes excruciating. The splinter is five inches long and growing.

dialogues.speaker: LONG.
dialogues.text: Julia drops the splinter into the sink. She moves away from the counter, the living room, unbelieving, horrified She stumbles towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: SHOP
dialogues.text: Julia walks out of the restroom. Stops cold. Everyone in the coffee shop is staring at her. The customers. The waiters The lights are dimming. A lack of power. Julia forces herself to move. She goes to her table, picks up the phot suddenly notices that in the graduation pictures --

dialogues.speaker: JULIA ARE TOGETHER IN EVERY PICTURE
dialogues.text: Julia grabs the photographs and turns around. The customers in the coffee shop are standing now. Their eyes are dark Something about the way they stand is completely unnatural. All wro Panic begins to settle in. Julia quickly walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Julia? She turns. The waiter stands behind her. Eyes burning. WAITER (cont'd) (menacing)  Why'd you take it out? That's enough. Julia gets the hell out of there.

dialogues.speaker: SHOP
dialogues.text: Julia bolts out the door and rushes across the street. She reaches her ca the alarm, and gets inside.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Julia drops the photos into the passenger seat. She answers it.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Hello? Starts the car. The CELL PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCISCO
dialogues.text: Paul on a pay phone. There's panic in his voice.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Julia. It's Paul.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: At a pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: What about your  Dad?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: He wouldn't let me in. He told me he didn't have a son. (then) Julia, everything in my wallet's gone. Credit cards. Money. Driv Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: between Julia and Paul.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Then it's already started.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: What's started? Terrified beat. Julia trains her eyes on the coffee shop.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Listen. There's not much time. They're watching me right now.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Who is?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Just listen to me. There were five of us at the cabin. (beat) Your best friend was with us. Joey. He had blond hair. He had a Su on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I don't know anyone named Joey.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: That's because they erased your memory. If you remembered him ... if you what they did to him, you might run like Sam. That would make it ha to hunt you down.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Where's Sam?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: They killed him.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: They?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Monsters. Paul can barely stand up. His skull is pounding.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Monsters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They really exist, Paul. They use human beings for parts. Like machin

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I can't take this.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: What you saw in the forest wasn't a hallucination. They've been watching time. Following us.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I can't --

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: There's a tracking device in your head. Right where the scab is.  Her words sound chilling in the night air. Foreboding and deadly. Paul is dread.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: My head?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: They want us for parts. That's why they're tracking us. They take the it.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Just let me think for a second.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: They already got Sam and Terry. And now they're making us disappear. (then)  Think about it. Your wallet. Your father.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: It can't be true.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: It is true! We're next! Paul becomes upset. He nods with grave understanding.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: We have to get back home. They're all over the place, but we can make i

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Just below Union Square. Right near the cable cars.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: All right. There's a subway station near there.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I can see it. Where they turn them around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait for me. At the top of the stairs. I'll be there in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (in pain) I love you. Please hurry. Paul hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Julia tosses down the cell phone. The car engine STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: What now? She tries to start the car, but it the engine won't turn over. Just as to try a second time, she looks out the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: STREET.
dialogues.text: Julia frantically tries to start the car again. No dice. She rips open  the door.

dialogues.speaker: SHOP
dialogues.text: Julia takes off running. The SHAPES pursue.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCISCO
dialogues.text: Julia turns a corner and runs straight into an intersection.

dialogues.speaker: A HORN BLARES
dialogues.text: as a BUS barrels towards her. Julia barely leaps out of the way as the bus SCREECHES to a halt, near her down. She rises to her feet as the bus starts moving again. Several of the passengers have their faces pressed against the windows. Dark circles around their eyes.  Julia keeps going. The PURSUING CUSTOMERS from the coffee shop are ma opposite corner by traffic. They stand motionless. Watching her es

dialogues.speaker: STATION ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: A long flight of stone stairs leads down to the BART and MUNI stations sits down on the steps. Looking. Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCISCO
dialogues.text: Julia charges down the sidewalk. Weaving past bystanders. As she runs, Julia brushes past THE LITTLE GIRL from Sam's graduation Standing abnormally. She watches Julia race off into the crowd wit soulless eyes.

dialogues.speaker: STATION ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Paul is sitting still. His head cradled in his hands. A SHAPE appears in front of him. Paul looks up. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Hey

dialogues.speaker: FRANCISCO
dialogues.text: Julia races across the intersection and streaks towards the subway st entrance.

dialogues.speaker: STATION ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Paul is nowhere to be found. The stairs are empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul?! Julia looks around desperately. She can't find him in the crowds on t She turns and looks down the stairs towards the open entryway to th system. Paul is walking through the entryway. A friend with him is patting him on shoulder. Just after Paul has disappeared through the entryway, the frie around. IT'S SAM. His lips are parched, pitch black eyes bulging, his features somehow m and unfamiliar. His face twitches as he stares coldly at Juli runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: She frantically rushes down the stairs. JULIA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: She rushes through the entryway.

dialogues.speaker: STATION
dialogues.text: The upper level is almost completely empty save a few kids and late-night Julia is hysterical now. The first time we've seen her lose contro She looks around frantically. Spots Paul and Sam going down the es together.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Paul! Julia rushes towards the turnstiles. Jumps them. A GUARD steps out of

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Hey! You need a ticket! Hey!!! She keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: STATION
dialogues.text: Paul and Sam reach the bottom of the escalators. They move towards the The lights start twinkling. Losing power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) I thought you said she'd be here. Sam smirks back, mute ... and GRABS HIM BY THE THROAT. The lights GO OUT.

dialogues.speaker: STATION
dialogues.text: Julia bolts down the escalator.

dialogues.speaker: STATION
dialogues.text: She reaches the platform and rushes to the center.  There's nobody else down there. The lights are flickering. Slowly, they normal.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: (calling) Paul?! No response. A train RUMBLES through the station. Julia moves to the opposite side and Resting on the tracks, leading into the tunnel, are a trail of metal pie like the ones from the cabin. Julia looks back. The GUARD is coming down the escalator. Without hesitation, she jumps down to the tracks. Moving quickly down to avoid being seen, she rushes into the awaiting subway tun

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Drowned in shadows. An unnatural silence fills the tunnel. Julia moves cautiously amongst the tracks. Eyes scanning the darkness the trail of discarded metal.

dialogues.speaker: HISSING.
dialogues.text: Julia spins around. A few more HISSING SOUNDS rise from electrical sp tracks. Blue light flashes within the tunnel. Then, it ceases. She turns back to continue her search, wind sifting through her hair, wh

dialogues.speaker: HOLE
dialogues.text: At the base of the subway wall. Julia reaches down and palms a few metal the base of the hole. She peers inside. A dull flickering light flashes within. Julia takes a calming breath. She moves into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: A narrow and claustrophobic space. Julia squirms through the confined pulling herself towards the flashing light.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Julia pulls herself through another opening and finds herself standi threshold of a corridor. Both the walls and floor are constructed of cru grates and long pipes. Anything could be hiding within. Waiting. She moves slowly into the corridor, a STROBE LIGHT flickering aroun gropes towards another opening. The sound of her TERRIFIED BREATHING is slowly replaced by the RHYTHMI MACHINES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steam rises from the pipes. Bathing the stairwell in mist. The fluorescent lights above are glimmering in the darkness. Julia stands of the stairwell. She can't even see the bottom of the steps. Carefully, she  starts moving down. Her hand gripping the metal railing. The HUMMING OF MACHINES grows louder Her foot accidentally kicks a few pieces of metal on the steps. A CLINKING as the metal scatters down ahead of her. The HUMMING OF MACHINES is closer now. Just beyond the sheathing clouds white mist. The metal railing is suddenly replaced by HUMAN BONES. Julia pulls her hand away from the railing. Looks skyward and discovers m being used to brace the ceiling along with metal beams. She stops. Shutting her eyes in fear. Starts to lose control.  From somewhere within, she manages to steady herself. Keeps going throug awaiting steam curtain at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAYS
dialogues.text: The steam parts to reveal a dark space. Cold and damp. Julia moves into the main hallway, stumbling through a hallway that c described as a living nightmare. Mammoth pipes and human skin has been together into a wall, pulsating with the HEARTBEAT OF MACHINES tha the entire hallway. Steam jets into the hallway intermittently from the pipes. Creating great Julia is beyond horrified. Her face registers a numbness. Complete and to astonishment.  Human bones and body parts have been so expertly fashioned into the corri impossible to distinguish where the organic ends and the begins. She enters another corridor. Her face is struck by a JET OF HISSING She presses onward. Slipping past the skulls and littered metal on th Another BLAST OF STEAM. Something leaps out of the middle of it. Julia whirls back around a corner, pressing flat against the wall as a moves through the steam. Unidentifiable features. Movements tha nothing by chaos and madness. The SHAPE HISSES and CROAKS in the hallway.  Julia waits. She doesn't even breathe. The HISSING stops. She gradually turns to peek back into the hallway where the thing once

dialogues.speaker: JULIA'S EYES
dialogues.text: as she looks around the corner. The shape has disappeared. Carefully she keeps going forward. Drenched in water and sweat. Slippin steam clouds that mask another entrance.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: A massive room where empty human skins are dangling from hooks, complete preserved from head to toe. The skins sway and rock gently in the draft. them.  Julia moves towards the center of the room. A large OPERATING TABLE awaits. But the surface of the table is s water basin. Next to the table is a pedestal littered with BLOO INSTRUMENTS. Cutting tools. Knives. Curved hooks. Julia notices that Paul's torn clothes are resting at the foot of the t shredded to a rag. Sneakers orphaned nearby. Jeans spattered with blo Her breathing quickens. Her heart POUNDING. She reaches the foot of the table. Paul is lying within the basin, comple and partially covered with LITTERED BODY PARTS. Organs and en The basin is filled with water and blood. An immobile form is resting  Julia moves quickly. She tries to wake him up.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Paul. Paul, wake up. He stirs. His nose crinkles slightly. JULIA (cont'd) Wake up. She grabs him and lifts him up. He starts COUGHING. JULIA (cont'd) You've gotta hurry. (then)  Here Julia grabs his jeans. She helps him slide down from the basin and he pul A skinned HAND grabs hers. Julia yelps a SCREAM. The other form -- a THING in the basin -- rises and turns. Slicked with blood. Empty sockets where the ey Mouth falling open. A horror that shouldn't be alive. Julia SCREAMS again. Her free hand grabs a HOOK from the pedestal and swings the blade into neck. Blood fountains up. The thing begins SHRIEKING. With Paul leaning on her for support, Julia rapidly heads for the

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAYS
dialogues.text: Julia navigates her way through the hallways. Moving blindly through sudd STEAM, the sound of MACHINES around them. Paul leans on her, his eye closed, COUGHING and stumbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racing through the halls. The steam clouds suddenly EXPLODING into her v

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia reaches the stairwell and helps Paul climb the steps. She looks b shoulder. Nothing behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia stops at the corridor opening. The strobe light FLASHES within. Cl The corridor looks empty. Nothing but pipes and shadows.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: We're almost there. Julia turns to Paul and finds a face with glaring yellow eyes and metal stares back at her. A moment of sheer horror. Julia reels back into the corridor. Pressed the wall. Sliding towards the crawl space opening. Paul starts advancing into the corridor. Grinning with teeth that fla click of  the strobe light. She keeps sliding away He grabs his chest and RIPS IT OPEN, tearing the covering skin apart a shirt. A menagerie of human bones and metal are revealed behind it Julia tries to scream. Eyes wide. She can't make a sound. Paul tears the skin covering his chest wider. Pulling it away. Stripping clean. Julia reaches the crawl space. Sliding down. The last pieces Paul's skin are torn off. The thing that had been pretend Paul stands in his place. Only brief glimpses are allowed by the strobe light. An abysm of im lunacy consisting of fashioned human parts and twisted metal. A beating within exposed ribs. Bones combined with pulleys and rods a skull. A contradiction of all matter and cosmic order. Julia slips back into the crawl space. Still

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: Julia drags herself through the crawl space.

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Julia squeezes herself through the exposed hole. into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL
dialogues.text: trying to scream. Moving quickly. Panicked. She kicks to her feet and tears off  Julia has almost reached the platform opening for the train.

dialogues.speaker: STATION
dialogues.text: Julia runs directly parallel to the subway platform. The lights alon start flickering and go out, one by one, as she advances.

dialogues.speaker: SCREAMING CONTINUES TO RISE.
dialogues.text: She reaches the opposite tunnel and grabs hold of the platform, pulling h The platform goes dark. Appearing out of the far tunnel are a DOZEN DARK SHAPES, scampering alo and running on all fours across the tracks. Their characteri visible. Julia kicks back as the shrieking things bear down on her, yellow eye the dark, metal teeth flashing. Julia tries to run for the escalator, but the things cover the walls beh tracks. Ready to spring. Finally, one of the monsters does leap towards her

dialogues.speaker: TO BITS BY AN APPROACHING BART TRAIN.
dialogues.text: Reducing the monster to a few vestiges of scattered metal. The other c the tracks are also run down. Julia watches as the train RUMBLES past. And then, silence.  Nothing is left except for a few swirling newspapers. The lights flicker to life. Rising up to her feet, rescued from death by chance, Julia starts back the escalator. Her eyes locked upon the darkened tunnel befor and races up.

dialogues.speaker: STATION ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Rain has started falling again. Pelting the stairs. Julia dashes up the stairwell and sprints into the street. She doesn't lo

dialogues.speaker: FRANCISCO
dialogues.text: The rain falls so heavily that it creates a dense, blue FOG which shroud street. Julia appears through the storm, running towards a telephone booth on t corner. She rips open the door, steps inside, and slams the door shut

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH
dialogues.text: She drops a few quarters into the phone. Dials. And waits.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSE
dialogues.text: Dark and still. Lightning frames the windows. The picture of Julia and he rests near a phone as the line RINGS. Guy comes downstairs and answers the portable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Static. GUY (cont'd) (bewildered) Is anyone there?

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH
dialogues.text: A flash of LIGHTNING outside.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Daddy? ... It's Julia  (beat) They might still be around ... feeding on power from the phone lines hear me? (beat) . Dad?

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: (over phone) I can't hear you. Hello? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Daddy, help me . help me, please

dialogues.speaker: RESIDENCE
dialogues.text: More STATIC resounds over the phone. Guy hesitates a moment, then ret portable to the cradle.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH
dialogues.text: CLICK. The line is abruptly cut off. Julia begins to cry. She covers her face with her hands. The tears roll t fingers.

dialogues.speaker: RESIDENCE
dialogues.text: Guy stares at the phone for a moment. A strange feeling. Something isn't right. He thinks a moment. Then and heads upstairs, moving directly past the picture next to the ph  JULIA IS GONE.

dialogues.speaker: VANISHED FROM THE PICTURE WITHOUT A TRACE. ONLY HER MOTHE
dialogues.text: Lightning flashes across the picture's glass frame.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCISCO
dialogues.text: The afternoon rush of people trying to get home.

dialogues.speaker: A GROUP OF
dialogues.text: THREE COLLEGE STUDENTS come down the escalator into the s CONNOR is among them, now eighteen and wearing a Berkeley sweatshirt. His BARRY and MIKE.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: Why the hell didn't we bring the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna pay for gas?

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: Better than this shit. I hate BART.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: He has a point. I made the mistake of trying to use the bathroom. What do do? Stand with their ass hanging over the toilet and aim? Connor checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: We're late. Party started an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll make it.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: (trace of sarcasm) Yeah Connor. Relax. We might get there right after the kegs dry out.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: (resigned) I should study anyway.

dialogues.speaker: A FEMALE VOICE
dialogues.text: calls out from across the platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor? He turns around and scans the crowd, locating a ragged figure that moves towards him. With her dirty clothing and sunken eyes, it takes a momen register. This is Julia. Her skin is pale. Her hair is stringy and knotted.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: I've been looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: (hushed) Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just ignore her.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: They tried to get me. Several times. But I Managed to get away. I've always managed to get away. A train rushes into the station. Connor is speechless.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: I'm ... sorry

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: But you'll help me. You will help me. Connor raises his hands and backs towards the train as the doors slide friends are already aboard.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: No, wait it's Julia ... don't you remember? He gets into the train. His friends are laughing. Connor turns to his a look of smirking disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: How the fuck did she know my name?

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: She heard me  say it.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: (overlapping) It's Julia! I'm your sister! The doors slide closed in her face.

dialogues.speaker: TRAIN
dialogues.text: Julia begins beating on the doors to be heard. Connor and his friends freaked but they're still laughing at her.

dialogues.speaker: I'M YOUR SISTER
dialogues.text: The train starts to move. People inside move in front of the doors Julia's view of her brother. JULIA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: LEAVE ME
dialogues.text: Julia runs alongside the train. Still beating on the doors. Her face tears. JULIA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: TO KILL ME
dialogues.text: (shrieks)  The train picks up speed. Julia is left behind. The grinding of the wheels is heard as the train moves into the subway tu SOUND OF MACHINES drowns out every other sound and consumes all. BLACKOUT.
